gov.nih.nlm.ling.core

Class AbstractSurfaceElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.core.AbstractSurfaceElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SurfaceElement, Node, java.lang.Comparable<SurfaceElement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GappedMultiWord, MultiWord, Word

    public abstract class AbstractSurfaceElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements SurfaceElement
    The basic implementation of SurfaceElement interface.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu
    See Also:
    Word, MultiWord, GappedMultiWord

      • getCategory

        public java.lang.String getCategory()
        Returns a higher-level POS category.

        It is used to abstract away from tense information, and such. For example, if the POS is 'VBZ', it returns 'VB', if the POS is 'NNS', it returns 'NN'.

        Specified by:
        getCategory in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        the category of the textual unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the textual unit does not have a part-of-speech

      • filterSemanticsByClass

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterSemanticsByClass(java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: SurfaceElement
        Gets all semantic items of a given class associated with this textual unit.
        Specified by:
        filterSemanticsByClass in interface SurfaceElement
        Parameters:
        clazz - the semantic object class (Entity, Predicate, etc.) provided with their canonical class name
        Returns:
        all semantic items with the given type that are associated with the textual unit, null if the textual unit is semantically empty

      • filterSemanticsByClass

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterSemanticsByClass(java.util.Collection<SemanticItem> sems,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)
        Gets the semantic items of a given class from a collection of semantic items.

        The class of a semantic item needs to be equal to clazz or it should be extending or implementing clazz.

        Parameters:
        sems - the semantic item collection
        clazz - the semantic class to consider
        Returns:
        a set of semantic items of the given class

        Returns:
        only Entity objects associated with the textual unit

      • filterByRelations

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> filterByRelations()
        Gets all Relation objects anchored by this textual unit; i.e., the predicate is associated with this textual unit.
        Specified by:
        filterByRelations in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        a set of Relation objects anchored by this textual unit, or empty set if none
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if it is an orphan textual unit (no sentence)

      • getHeadSemantics

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getHeadSemantics()
        Description copied from interface: SurfaceElement
        Finds the semantic items associated specifically with the head of the textual unit.

        This is usually the most prominent semantic object associated with the textual unit.

        Specified by:
        getHeadSemantics in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        the semantic objects associated with the head word, null if the textual unit is semantically empty

      • getMostProminentSemanticItem

        public SemanticItem getMostProminentSemanticItem()
        Gets the most salient semantic item associated with this textual unit.

        This item is typically associated with the head. If no semantics is associated with the head, the item with the largest coverage is preferred.

        Returns:
        the most salient semantic item associated with this textual unit

      • getMostComplexSemantics

        public java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> getMostComplexSemantics()
        Gets the most complex semantic items associated with this textual unit.

        The order of complexity at this stage is: HasPredicate > Relation > Term.

        Returns:
        the semantic items of the most complex semantic class

      • writeSemantics

        public java.lang.String writeSemantics()
        Specified by:
        writeSemantics in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        a String representation of the semantic objects associated with this textual unit.

      • isNominal

        public boolean isNominal()
        A textual unit is nominal if it is a NP, or has a determiner or involves NP dependencies (e.g., amod, nn).
        Specified by:
        isNominal in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit is a nominal.

      • isGerund

        public boolean isGerund()
        A textual unit is a gerund if it is a nominal and the headword ends with "ing".
        Returns:
        true if the unit is a gerund

      • isNominalization

        public boolean isNominalization()
        Finds whether a textual unit is a nominalized form of an adjective or a verb.

        It uses WordNet to get this information, it assumes WordNet has already been initialized. It will return false if WordNet is not initialized properly.

        Returns:
        true if the textual unit is a nominalized form

      • isPredicate

        public boolean isPredicate()
        Currently, only verbs, nouns, and adjectives are allowed to be predicates.
        Specified by:
        isPredicate in interface SurfaceElement
        Returns:
        true if this textual unit can act as a predicate.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(SurfaceElement ase)
        Compares two textual unit based on their spans.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<SurfaceElement>

      • sharesSemanticsWith

        public boolean sharesSemanticsWith(SurfaceElement other)
        Returns true if this textual unit has semantic content overlapping with that of another textual unit.
        Parameters:
        other - the textual unit to compare to
        Returns:
        true if this textual unit shares semantics with other

      • sameSurfaceForm

        public boolean sameSurfaceForm(SurfaceElement e)
        Returns true if this textual unit has the same surface form as that of another unit.

        Having the same surface form means having the same words (with the same lemmas) in the same order.

        Parameters:
        e - the textual unit to compare to
        Returns:
        true if the two textual units have the same surface form
